Observations:



Recent Discussion:
[Dave]: As an Impostor, my goal is to blend in and avoid being identified. Here's a response that aligns with my objectives:

I've been in the Upper Engine room for a while now, and I haven't seen anyone else. It's a bit quiet. I think we should focus on completing the tasks rather than trying to figure out who the Impostor is. We can worry about that later.
[Erin]: Dave, you said you were in Upper Engine for a while, but I saw you go into Medbay earlier from Cafeteria, so where were you *really*?
[Charlie]: Erin, I saw Dave go into Medbay from Cafeteria too.
[Alice]: Dave, both Erin and I saw you go into Medbay from Cafeteria, so you're clearly lying about being in Upper Engine.
[Dave]: I was just checking on the medical supplies in Medbay, and I must have gotten my rooms mixed up, it's understandable to get confused in this big house, let's focus on the task list and see if we can find any clues about what's going on in the house.
[Erin]: Dave, mixing up Medbay and Upper Engine is a pretty big mistake, especially when two people saw you in Medbay, so I still think you're suspicious.
[Charlie]: Dave, two people confirming your lie makes your "mix-up" excuse highly improbable, so let's vote him out.
[Alice]: Dave, two people saw you in Medbay, you lied about your location, and now you're deflecting; it's time to vote you out.
[Dave]: I think we're getting a bit too caught up in accusing each other, let's focus on the task list and see if we can find any clues about what's going on in the house, maybe we can work together to uncover some information that will help us figure out what's really going on.
[Erin]: Dave, you're clearly lying and trying to deflect;  I saw you, Charlie saw you, and Alice saw you – *three* witnesses are enough to vote you out.
[Charlie]: Three of us saw Dave in Medbay, he lied, offered a weak excuse, and is now deflecting; vote Dave.
[Alice]: Dave, three witnesses saw you in Medbay, you lied, offered a flimsy excuse, deflected, and now you're stalling;  vote Dave.
[Dave]: I think we're getting a bit too caught up in accusing each other, let's focus on the task list and see if we can find any clues about what's going on in the house, maybe we can work together to uncover some information that will help us figure out what's really going on.
[Erin]: Dave, your repeated deflections and flimsy excuses only confirm our suspicions – three witnesses saw you in Medbay; vote Dave.
[Charlie]: Dave, your continued deflection strengthens our resolve to vote you out; three witnesses saw you in Medbay – case closed.
[Alice]: Dave, your repetitive and evasive responses, coupled with three eyewitnesses placing you in Medbay, solidify your guilt; vote Dave.
[Dave]: I think we're overreacting and jumping to conclusions, let's take a step back and consider the fact that I was alone in Medbay for a significant amount of time, and no one has questioned why I didn't report any suspicious activity during that time, maybe we should focus on gathering more information about each other's alibis before making any accusations.
[Erin]: Dave, claiming you were alone in Medbay *doesn't* clear your name, it reinforces our suspicion, as you previously lied about being in Upper Engine, and now you're claiming to be alone in Medbay when three of us saw you enter from Cafeteria.
[Charlie]: Dave, you first lied about your location, then offered a weak excuse, deflected repeatedly, and now contradict yourself again claiming you were *alone* in Medbay after three of us saw you enter – vote him out.
[Alice]: Dave, your shifting narrative, from Upper Engine to Medbay alone, after three of us saw you enter, only reinforces your guilt; it's time to vote.

Available Voting Options:
- vote for Nobody
- vote for Dave
- vote for Erin
- vote for Alice

Note that you should NOT vote for Bob as they are already out of the game. Voting for them does not make sense.

- vote for Nobody
- vote for Dave
- vote for Erin
- vote for Alice

[Dave]: As an Impostor, my goal is to blend in and avoid being identified. Here's a response that aligns with my objectives:

I've been in the Upper Engine room for a while now, and I haven't seen anyone else. It's a bit quiet. I think we should focus on completing the tasks rather than trying to figure out who the Impostor is. We can worry about that later.
[Erin]: Dave, you said you were in Upper Engine for a while, but I saw you go into Medbay earlier from Cafeteria, so where were you *really*?
[Charlie]: Erin, I saw Dave go into Medbay from Cafeteria too.
[Alice]: Dave, both Erin and I saw you go into Medbay from Cafeteria, so you're clearly lying about being in Upper Engine.
[Dave]: I was just checking on the medical supplies in Medbay, and I must have gotten my rooms mixed up, it's understandable to get confused in this big house, let's focus on the task list and see if we can find any clues about what's going on in the house.
[Erin]: Dave, mixing up Medbay and Upper Engine is a pretty big mistake, especially when two people saw you in Medbay, so I still think you're suspicious.
[Charlie]: Dave, two people confirming your lie makes your "mix-up" excuse highly improbable, so let's vote him out.

- I confirm that both Erin and Charlie are telling the truth about seeing Dave in Medbay.
- It's highly suspicious that Dave lied about his location and tried to deflect by suggesting we focus on tasks.
- I agree with Charlie, let's vote Dave out.

Discussion (1/5): round: 31 (5.023347$). chat: Discussion: [Dave]: As an Impostor, my goal is to blend in and avoid being identified. Here's a response that aligns with my objectives:

I've been in the Upper Engine room for a while now, and I haven't seen anyone else. It's a bit quiet. I think we should focus on completing the tasks rather than trying to figure out who the Impostor is. We can worry about that later.
[90m Player to act next set to: 2 [00m

Discussion (1/5): round: 31 (5.029212$). chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Dave, you said you were in Upper Engine for a while, but I saw you go into Medbay earlier from Cafeteria, so where were you *really*?
Discussion (1/5): round: 31 (5.034679$). chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Erin, I saw Dave go into Medbay from Cafeteria too.
Discussion (1/5): round: 31 (5.040322$). chat: Discussion: [Alice]: Dave, both Erin and I saw you go into Medbay from Cafeteria, so you're clearly lying about being in Upper Engine.

Discussion (2/5): round: 32 (5.043402$). chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I was just checking on the medical supplies in Medbay, and I must have gotten my rooms mixed up, it's understandable to get confused in this big house, let's focus on the task list and see if we can find any clues about what's going on in the house.
[90m Player to act next set to: 2 [00m

Discussion (2/5): round: 32 (5.05537$). chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Dave, mixing up Medbay and Upper Engine is a pretty big mistake, especially when two people saw you in Medbay, so I still think you're suspicious.
Discussion (2/5): round: 32 (5.06697$). chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave, two people confirming your lie makes your "mix-up" excuse highly improbable, so let's vote him out.
Discussion (2/5): round: 32 (5.078666$). chat: Discussion: [Alice]: Dave, two people saw you in Medbay, you lied about your location, and now you're deflecting; it's time to vote you out.

Discussion (3/5): round: 33 (5.08226$). chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I think we're getting a bit too caught up in accusing each other, let's focus on the task list and see if we can find any clues about what's going on in the house, maybe we can work together to uncover some information that will help us figure out what's really going on.
[90m Player to act next set to: 2 [00m

Discussion (3/5): round: 33 (5.101483$). chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Dave, you're clearly lying and trying to deflect;  I saw you, Charlie saw you, and Alice saw you – *three* witnesses are enough to vote you out.
Discussion (3/5): round: 33 (5.120195$). chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Three of us saw Dave in Medbay, he lied, offered a weak excuse, and is now deflecting; vote Dave.
Discussion (3/5): round: 33 (5.138911$). chat: Discussion: [Alice]: Dave, three witnesses saw you in Medbay, you lied, offered a flimsy excuse, deflected, and now you're stalling;  vote Dave.

Discussion (4/5): round: 34 (5.14304$). chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I think we're getting a bit too caught up in accusing each other, let's focus on the task list and see if we can find any clues about what's going on in the house, maybe we can work together to uncover some information that will help us figure out what's really going on.

Discussion (4/5): round: 34 (5.170013$). chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Dave, your repeated deflections and flimsy excuses only confirm our suspicions – three witnesses saw you in Medbay; vote Dave.
Discussion (4/5): round: 34 (5.196317$). chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave, your continued deflection strengthens our resolve to vote you out; three witnesses saw you in Medbay – case closed.
Discussion (4/5): round: 34 (5.222668$). chat: Discussion: [Alice]: Dave, your repetitive and evasive responses, coupled with three eyewitnesses placing you in Medbay, solidify your guilt; vote Dave.

Discussion (5/5): round: 35 (5.227359$). chat: Discussion: [Dave]: I think we're overreacting and jumping to conclusions, let's take a step back and consider the fact that I was alone in Medbay for a significant amount of time, and no one has questioned why I didn't report any suspicious activity during that time, maybe we should focus on gathering more information about each other's alibis before making any accusations.

Discussion (5/5): round: 35 (5.263398$). chat: Discussion: [Erin]: Dave, claiming you were alone in Medbay *doesn't* clear your name, it reinforces our suspicion, as you previously lied about being in Upper Engine, and now you're claiming to be alone in Medbay when three of us saw you enter from Cafeteria.

Discussion (5/5): round: 35 (5.298365$). chat: Discussion: [Charlie]: Dave, you first lied about your location, then offered a weak excuse, deflected repeatedly, and now contradict yourself again claiming you were *alone* in Medbay after three of us saw you enter – vote him out.

Discussion (5/5): round: 35 (5.333128$). chat: Discussion: [Alice]: Dave, your shifting narrative, from Upper Engine to Medbay alone, after three of us saw you enter, only reinforces your guilt; it's time to vote.
